description.narrative: New Element,which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: South Sudan increasingly implements child-sensitive policies and social protection programmes

sector.narrative: Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)
PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation

title.narrative: South Sudan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
South Sudan United Nations Cooperation Framework 2019-2021
South Sudan Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change (Social Policy)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 EO: UNICEF Response to the South Sudan Humanitarian Situation
South Sudan 2018 Annual Report on Results for Children
South Sudan 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
South Sudan 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: With UNICEF support, strategic evidence on budgets including the National Budget Brief and Education Budget Brief were used to advocate on the importance of increased allocations for child outcomes; these were jointly developed and launched by the Ministry of Finance and Planning and Ministry of Education. Two Citizens' Budgets for the Draft Budget and Enacted Budget were produced. More budget documents than ever before are on Ministerial websites, in line with the Open Budget Index. 300 Ministry practitioners from 32 States have increased knowledge and skills on budget preparation and execution through three state level budget preparation workshops. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2020

title.narrative: 3.3 Strengthened capacity of stakeholders in budgeting at all levels of government to improve spending outcomes for children

baseline.value: Scale 1 -UNICEF is working on strengthening capacities of stakeholders to improve spending outcomes for children

target.value: 2021:Scale 3 -Country has improved spending outcomes for children as a result of strengthened capacities of key stakeholders

title.narrative: 3.1 Citizens (including children) empowered to participate in (sub)national budget process to improve budget transparency and accountability

target.value: 2021:Score 3 -Fully developed mechanism, but no policy impact

title.narrative: 3.2 Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children

target.value: 2021:Score 3 - Advanced Evidence generated and budget allocation improved
